item.title: Fly tipping, 10th August
item.description:
As you can see from the photos someone had dumped household furniture outside the flats there I also a bag of used nappies and tampons which has split open and are now all across the street this is absolutely disgusting I have reported this many times and the council does NOTHING I am going to have to write to my local councillor next

item.title: Trees and Hedges growing into Property, 10th August
item.description:
Dear Royal Borough of Greenwich Parks and Estates Department, I am writing to bring to your attention the ongoing issue with the poplar trees located at the end of our gardens. It has been five years since we last contacted you regarding this matter, and there are still branches hanging precariously. We have consistently collaborated with your department to maintain our northern and eastern boundaries, which are defined by a hawthorn hedge at the back under the poplars and palisade fencing at the side. This fencing was erected to prevent drug dealers from escaping over my fence/hedge. As a result, the area between my garage and the hedge has become inaccessible for pruning and clearing using my garden tools. This situation has become urgent due to an oak tree growing into the garage and across the roof to the door on the other side. I have attached photos to illustrate this, as well as the small-leaved lime tree and alder that are also encroaching over the property from the dead park space. There is also a rhododendron, but it is growing away from the structure. In the past, I have pruned the privet and mixed hedge shrubs such as yew, alder, and oak, and placed the cuttings on the old tarmac path remnant by the old (now railings) entrance in the front corner for disposal. This time, I require assistance from your staff as I injured my arm on the palisade fence while trying to reach across with loppers. I would be grateful if your staff could assist with this request. I can offer drinks and chocolate biscuits to those who are tasked with this job. Yours sincerely, Russ Hackwood For and on behalf of Tracy Stabler No.38 and Krysia Cowell No.40, SE9 3QT

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Southwood Road, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown hedge blocking path next to busy road near primary school, 10th August
item.description:
Big hedge is never cut back to legal limit - it always overhangs even when trimmed. This is used by small kids and parents with prams right next to a busy road. Please make the landlords take responsibility and explain the dangers and the need for proper attention and pruning. You do not want to be responsible partly for an accident due to lack of attention on your part. (This acts as a record, as do other similar requests.) Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-6, Barry Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unauthorized Parking in My Designated Space, 10th August
item.description:
It has been over a month since this vehicle has been parked in my designated parking space. Despite our polite request, placed as a note on the vehicle, asking the owner not to park there, the car continues to occupy the spot. Additionally, it appears that the vehicleâ€™s owner has attempted to remove our spot number. I kindly request your assistance in having this vehicle removed from my parking space so that I may resume using it as intended.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Talehangers Close, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet
